items.title: Exports help French December manufacturing grow at fastest rate in more than three years, PMI shows
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- France's final manufacturing PMI rose to 50.7 in December from 47.8, the strongest since June 2022 and above the flash estimate. 
- New export orders rose at the fastest pace in nearly four years, helped by the aerospace sector (e.g., Safran's India growth outlook). 
- Political uncertainty over France's budget could weigh on 2026 conditions despite the upturn.

items.title: Italian manufacturing contracts in December at fastest rate since March, PMI shows
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Italy's manufacturing PMI fell to 47.9 in December from 50.6 in November, signaling contraction and the steepest deterioration since March.
- New orders dropped to 47.0 and output to 46.8, marking the fastest declines in nine months.
- The government projects about 0.7% growth for 2026; Nils Muller of Hamburg Commercial Bank attributes the downturn to declines in output and new orders.

items.title: UK house price growth weakest since April 2024 after surprise December drop
items.author: David Milliken
items.summary:
- Nationwide: UK house prices fell 0.4% in December 2025; annual growth 0.6% for 2025, weakest since Apr 2024.
- Affordability improved as earnings rose and mortgage rates fell, supporting demand; December 2024 strength and near-pre-pandemic approvals noted.
- Outlook: BoE cut rate to 3.75%; 2026 growth seen 2-4%; regional moves include London +0.7% YoY, NI +9.7%, eastern England −0.8%.

items.title: Italy says US has sharply cut proposed pasta tariffs
items.author: Crispian Balmer
items.summary:
- US Commerce Department cuts proposed duties on Italian pasta: La Molisana 2.26%, Garofalo 13.98%, others 9.09%.
- Earlier plan would have added up to 92% on top of the 15% duty for 13 firms; final decision due by March 12, with possible 60‑day extension.
- The 13 firms account for about 16% of U.S. pasta imports from Italy; 2024 Italian pasta exports topped €4B, with the U.S. market about $800M.

items.title: Bulgaria celebrates entry into euro zone, lev currency banished into history
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Bulgaria formally joined the euro area at midnight on Jan 1, 2026, replacing the lev; euro coins were shown in Sofia and celebrations marked the milestone. 
- Public opinion is mixed, but businesses largely back the move; some fear price rises, while daily life already displayed prices in euros and lev on accession day. 
- The government recently resigned amid protests; accession expands euro-zone users to over 350 million, with Croatia the previous entrant in Jan 2023.

items.title: After Bulgaria, euro expansion faces hurdles in remaining EU states
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - Euro adoption in remaining states faces hurdles despite Bulgaria's entry, with uneven public support and active scepticism.\n- Eurobarometer shows 30-59% support across Hungary, Romania, Poland, Czechia, Sweden, and Denmark, shaped by politics and budgets.\n- No near-term timetable: debt, deficits, and sovereignty concerns constrain further momentum amid shifting governments.

items.title: Bridgewater's flagship Pure Alpha surges 33% in 2025, outperforming biggest hedge fund peers
items.author: Anirban Sen
items.summary:
- Bridgewater's flagship Pure Alpha gained about 33% YTD through Dec. 29, outpacing the S&P 500's ~17% rise in 2025, as macro funds posted record profits.
- Other Bridgewater funds posted solid gains: All Weather +20.4%, Asia Total Return +36.9%, China Total Return +34.2%, and AIA Macro +11.9%, with AUM around $92B as of Sept. 30.
- The firm has pushed AI investing (a $5B AI fund, an ETF with State Street, Artificial Investor tool) as founder Dalio exited; leadership changes underway.

items.title: Brookfield to start cloud business amid AI frenzy, The Information reports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Brookfield launches Radiant, a cloud unit to lease AI chips to developers, aiming end-to-end control of the AI stack and tying Radiant to a $10B Brookfield AI fund with priority data-center access.
- Plans include France, Qatar and Sweden, after a $100B AI infrastructure push anchored by Brookfield's AI Infrastructure Fund with about half of its $10B commitments from Nvidia and the Kuwait Investment Authority.
- The strategy targets AI capex and energy bottlenecks by owning inputs to the stack, potentially pressuring Amazon, Microsoft and Oracle on capital efficiency.

items.title: Trump Media unveils plan to distribute new cryptocurrency to shareholders
items.author: Manya Saini
items.summary:
- Trump Media and Technology Group will distribute a new digital token to shareholders—one token per share—with a 2026 launch planned on the Cronos blockchain.
- The plan deepens the Trump family's push into digital assets as crypto policy shows greater support, despite potential conflicts of interest scrutiny.
- This follows prior crypto activity by the family, including the $TRUMP meme coin and ventures like World Liberty Financial, amid a broader crypto downturn.
